addressleaf.section: A Monsieur Monsieur de Sidney chevalier et Gouverneur de la ville de Vlissingnes.

page.lettertext:
fol.193r
S
r
Tho Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
Heere is nothing sturring, that is worth
e
writing to yo
r
L. Only as this day we
are informed,
at
e castel of
Anholt
is in
parley w
t
those of
Guelders.
I thinke yo
r
L. hath heard of
e taking of
e towne,
w
ch
was done by
Cap
t
Lambert
, w
t
out
commission from hens, and in
at respect
disliked: but yet
e contrey is c
o
tented
to reape
e benefit of his service. We
looke every houre for
Count Maurice
re-
turne, till when it will not be resolved
w
at
is next to be attempted. Howbeit
Nieumeghen
is chiefly thought upon.
I would gladly heare from yo
w
, howe
yo
w
purpose to execut yo
r
long inten-
ded surprise. Whether yo
w
hitte or
faile, there is nether danger nor disho-
nor. But yo
r
L.
at knoweth every
circ
u
stance, will putte in practise w
at
is best. If yo
r
leave for
En gl
a
d
be graunted, I beseeche yo
w
lett me
knowe it some litle time before. For
I would write a worde by yo
r
L.
about my revocation: and w
t
all I
would intreat yo
w
, to affourde me of
yo
r
favo
r
, if it come yo
w
well to passe.
I have all
e reason in
e world to
alleage for my self: as yo
r
L. er yow
goe, shall be thorowly instructed.
Besides, I have her
Ma
ties
promise for
e end of this sommer. In this or
any thing els I will make
at reckoning of yo
r
willingnes to pleasure
me, as yo
w
I hope will account
at I am yo
rs
at all essaies.
And so I bidde yow most hartely and happely farewell.
From
e Hage. Sep
t
21 1591. Yo
r
L. at c
o
maundem
t
Tho. Bodley
